title: Vegan Mushroom Risotto
description: A creamy and rich risotto made with arborio rice, fresh mushrooms, garlic, and vegetable broth, finished with nutritional yeast for a cheesy flavor.
steps: In a saucepan, heat the vegetable broth and keep it warm on low heat.
In a large pan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onion and garlic, sauté until translucent.
Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until softened.
Stir in the arborio rice and toast it for about 2 minutes, stirring frequently.
Begin adding the warm vegetable broth, one ladle at a time, stirring frequently until the liquid is mostly absorbed before adding more.
Continue this process until the rice is creamy and al dente, about 20 minutes.
Once done, stir in nutritional yeast, salt, and pepper.
Garnish with fresh parsley before serving.
author: AI-generated

title: Vegan Lentil Bolognese
description: A hearty and satisfying lentil-based sauce cooked with tomatoes, carrots, and herbs, served over your choice of pasta for a comforting Italian meal.
steps: Cook the pasta according to package instructions. Drain and set aside.
In a large pot, heat olive oil over medium heat. Add onion and garlic, sauté until translucent.
Stir in the diced carrots and cook for 5 minutes.
Add lentils, crushed tomatoes, oregano, basil, salt, and pepper. Mix well.
Simmer the sauce for 25-30 minutes until the lentils are tender, adding more water if needed.
Serve the lentil Bolognese sauce over cooked pasta.
author: AI-generated

title: Eggplant Parmesan Stacks
description: Layers of breaded and baked eggplant, marinara sauce, and vegan cheese, baked to perfection for a delightful vegan take on a classic Italian dish.
steps: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C).
Toss eggplant slices with olive oil, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and dried basil.
Coat eggplant slices in breadcrumbs and place them on a baking sheet.
Bake for 25 minutes, flipping halfway through until golden brown.
In a baking dish, layer eggplant, marinara sauce, and vegan cheese, repeating until all ingredients are used.
Top with nutritional yeast before baking for an additional 15 minutes until the cheese is melted.
Allow to cool slightly before serving.
author: AI-generated
